tests.name: Ambiguous pronoun - 'that' with multiple actions
tests.description: User says 'that' when referring to elements, context has multiple possibilities

input.intent: Change that | User intends to modify a website element but refers to it as 'that', which is ambiguous. The previous context mentions scrolling to footer and clicking submit button.
input.context: Scroll down to the footer section | Click on the submit button

response.intent: Change that | User intends to modify a website element but refers to it as 'that', which is ambiguous. The previous context mentions scrolling to footer and clicking submit button.
response.context: Scroll down to the footer section | Click on the submit button
response.reply: Hey, just to lock this down—are you looking to adjust the footer section or the submit button you clicked on earlier? "That" could be either, and I need to nail it.

tests.name: Ambiguous pronoun - 'it' with logo and text
tests.description: User says 'make it bigger' but unclear if referring to logo or text

input.intent: Make it bigger | User wants to increase size but 'it' is ambiguous. Context includes adding a logo and changing header text.
input.context: Add logo image to header | Change header text to 'Welcome'

response.intent: Make it bigger | User wants to increase size but 'it' is ambiguous. Context includes adding a logo and changing header text.
response.context: Add logo image to header | Change header text to 'Welcome'
response.reply: Quick clarification—when you say "make it bigger," are we talking about the logo image, the "Welcome" header text, or the header container? Just need to lock that down.

tests.name: Ambiguous pronoun - 'this' with navigation and button
tests.description: User says 'fix this' after creating multiple elements

input.intent: Fix this | User wants to fix something but 'this' could refer to the navigation menu or call-to-action button from previous context.
input.context: Create navigation menu with links | Add call-to-action button

response.intent: Fix this | User wants to fix something but 'this' could refer to the navigation menu or call-to-action button from previous context.
response.context: Create navigation menu with links | Add call-to-action button
response.reply: Alright, just to confirm—you want to fix the navigation menu or the call-to-action button? "This" could be either, and I need to zero in on the right spot.

tests.name: Vague reference - 'thing on top'
tests.description: Vague reference to 'thing on top' with multiple header elements

input.intent: Update the thing on top | User refers to an element as 'the thing on top' which is vague. Context shows header with logo, navigation, and search bar.
input.context: Add header with logo | Create navigation bar | Add search functionality

response.intent: Update the thing on top | User refers to an element as 'the thing on top' which is vague. Context shows header with logo, navigation, and search bar.
response.context: Add header with logo | Create navigation bar | Add search functionality
response.reply: Quick clarification—when you mention "update the thing on top," are we tweaking the logo, navigation bar, or search functionality from the header we added earlier?

tests.name: Vague reference - 'stuff in middle'
tests.description: Ambiguous reference to middle section content

input.intent: Modify the stuff in the middle section | User wants to change 'the stuff in the middle section' which is unclear. Context includes hero section, features grid, and testimonials.
input.context: Create hero section with title | Add features grid with 6 items | Add testimonials section

response.intent: Modify the stuff in the middle section | User wants to change 'the stuff in the middle section' which is unclear. Context includes hero section, features grid, and testimonials.
response.context: Create hero section with title | Add features grid with 6 items | Add testimonials section
response.reply: Quick clarification, Tony—when you say "modify the stuff in the middle section," are we talking about the features grid with those 6 items, or something else between the hero section and testimonials?

tests.name: Vague reference - 'the element'
tests.description: Generic reference to 'the element' with many form components

input.intent: Adjust the element | User says 'adjust the element' without specifying which one. Previous actions created form fields, labels, and submit button.
input.context: Add contact form with name and email fields | Add form labels | Style submit button

response.intent: Adjust the element | User says 'adjust the element' without specifying which one. Previous actions created form fields, labels, and submit button.
response.context: Add contact form with name and email fields | Add form labels | Style submit button
response.reply: Alright, you said "adjust the element"—but which one? The name field, email field, labels, or the submit button?

tests.name: Missing info - color target
tests.description: Color change request without specifying target element

input.intent: Change the color | User wants to change a color but doesn't specify what element. Context shows card background, text, and border styling.
input.context: Create pricing card | Style card background | Add border to card

response.intent: Change the color | User wants to change a color but doesn't specify what element. Context shows card background, text, and border styling.
response.context: Create pricing card | Style card background | Add border to card
response.reply: Got it, but which color are we tweaking—card background, text, or that border you just added?

tests.name: Missing info - resize target
tests.description: Resize request missing both target and dimensions

input.intent: Resize | User says 'resize' without specifying what or to what dimensions. Context includes image gallery with multiple images.
input.context: Add image gallery | Upload product images | Create image thumbnails

response.intent: Resize | User says 'resize' without specifying what or to what dimensions. Context includes image gallery with multiple images.
response.context: Add image gallery | Upload product images | Create image thumbnails
response.reply: Got it, but when you say "resize," are we talking about the image gallery container, the individual product images, or the thumbnails you just created, and what specific dimensions do you want them set to?

input.intent: Add a button | User wants to add a button but doesn't specify where. Context shows existing footer, sidebar, and header.
input.context: Create footer with social links | Add sidebar navigation | Update header layout

response.intent: Add a button | User wants to add a button but doesn't specify where. Context shows existing footer, sidebar, and header.
response.context: Create footer with social links | Add sidebar navigation | Update header layout
response.reply: Got it, but where should I place the button—footer with social links, sidebar navigation, or the updated header layout?

tests.name: Conflicting context
tests.description: Conflicting previous actions make reference ambiguous

input.intent: Change it back | User made contradictory changes and now wants to 'change it back' but unclear which change to revert. Context shows text color changed multiple times.
input.context: Change heading color to blue | Change heading color to red | Make heading bold

response.intent: Change it back | User made contradictory changes and now wants to 'change it back' but unclear which change to revert. Context shows text color changed multiple times.
response.context: Change heading color to blue | Change heading color to red | Make heading bold
response.reply: Got it, but when you say "change it back", are we undoing the bold or rolling the heading color back to blue? The last tweaks were blue, then red, then bold—I need to know which to reverse.

input.intent: Make it responsive | User wants responsive design but doesn't specify what component. Context includes layout, navigation, and images.
input.context: Create two-column layout | Add navigation menu | Add product images

response.intent: Make it responsive | User wants responsive design but doesn't specify what component. Context includes layout, navigation, and images.
response.context: Create two-column layout | Add navigation menu | Add product images
response.reply: Got it, but to nail the responsiveness—should I focus on the two-column layout, the navigation menu, or the product images? You mentioned all three, but which one’s the target?

tests.name: Special characters in request
tests.description: Request with special characters and ambiguous references

input.intent: Update <that> & fix the 'other' one | User request contains special characters and vague references. Context shows modal dialog and tooltip.
input.context: Create modal dialog with close button | Add tooltip to info icon

response.intent: Update <that> & fix the 'other' one | User request contains special characters and vague references. Context shows modal dialog and tooltip.
response.context: Create modal dialog with close button | Add tooltip to info icon
response.reply: Got it, but which "that" are we updating—your modal dialog with the close button or the tooltip on the info icon? And what's the "other" one you want fixed? Let me know to nail this.

tests.name: Multiple ambiguities
tests.description: Multiple vague references in one request

input.intent: Make that bigger and change its color to match the other one | User has multiple ambiguous references in single request. Context includes header, footer, and sidebar styling.
input.context: Style header with gradient background | Add footer with dark theme | Create sidebar with light colors

response.intent: Make that bigger and change its color to match the other one | User has multiple ambiguous references in single request. Context includes header, footer, and sidebar styling.
response.context: Style header with gradient background | Add footer with dark theme | Create sidebar with light colors
response.reply: Got it, but which element are we talking about for "that" (header, footer, or sidebar) and which "other one" should its color match?

tests.name: Technical jargon
tests.description: Technical jargon requiring clarification on scope

input.intent: Implement the WCAG AA compliance stuff | User uses technical jargon 'WCAG AA compliance stuff' which is vague. Context shows form and button creation.
input.context: Create login form | Add submit button | Style form inputs

response.intent: Implement the WCAG AA compliance stuff | User uses technical jargon 'WCAG AA compliance stuff' which is vague. Context shows form and button creation.
response.context: Create login form | Add submit button | Style form inputs
response.reply: Got it, but to nail that WCAG AA compliance for your login form—should I prioritize input labels, contrast ratios, submit button focus states, or another specific part you had in mind?

tests.name: Unrelated/nonsensical query
tests.description: Completely unrelated and nonsensical user input

input.intent: The purple monkey dishwasher needs adjustment | Completely nonsensical request that doesn't relate to web development. Context shows normal website editing.
input.context: Create homepage layout | Add hero section with image

response.intent: The purple monkey dishwasher needs adjustment | Completely nonsensical request that doesn't relate to web development. Context shows normal website editing.
response.context: Create homepage layout | Add hero section with image
response.reply: Wait, that "purple monkey dishwasher" adjustment—was that a playful slip-up, or did you actually mean tweaking the hero section image I just added? Let me know so I can help properly.
